case_title: GUL MUHAMMAD vs THE ASSISTANT COLLECTOR, CENTRAL EXCISE AND LAND CUSTOMS AND 2 Other
respondents: THE ASSISTANT COLLECTOR, CENTRAL EXCISE AND LAND CUSTOMS
Joint Secretary (Customs), Finance Department, Government of Pakistan

contraventions: Clauses (8) and (89) of Table to Section 156(1) of Customs Act (IV of 1969)

petitioner.claim: Car seized on 1974-06-05 under Section 168(1) of Customs Act; mandatory notice under Section 180 not served within two months; car should be returned without payment of customs duty.

respondents.claim: Car detained for verification on 1974-06-05; formal seizure occurred on 1974-11-14; notice served within statutory period; customs duty and dues must be paid.

court_findings.mandatory_notice: Not served within two months as per Section 168(2)
court_findings.import_violation: Car imported without permit, violating Section 31 of Imports and Exports Act and Customs Act clauses (8), (9), (89), and (90).
court_findings.burden_of_proof: Petitioner failed to prove lawful import and payment of customs duty.

decision.reasoning: Petitioner liable for customs duty and government dues; discretionary jurisdiction under Article 199 cannot favor possession of ill-gotten gains.
decision.relief: No effective relief granted; petition dismissed.
